intro: Obione, commonly known as the common obione, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and bloom in the summer months. Obione is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
